metadata.title: CVE-2023-3022 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the IPv6 module of the Linux kernel. The arg.result wasnot used consistently in fib6_rule_lookup, sometimes holding rt6_info andother times fib6_info. This was not accounted for in other parts of thecode where rt6_info was expected unconditionally, potentially leading to akernel panic in fib6_rule_suppress.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
